numbered_ace_sentences: 1. In general, women are more likely than men to communicate with their parents many times a week.
2. The majority of youth prefer to text their parents or to contact their parents rather than to see their parents.
3. I want to know how these answers vary with age.
4. It takes about 13 years to complete high school after entering kindergarten.
5. The survey includes people who are 18 years old.
6. The survey includes people who are 34 years old.
7. The age range from 18 years to 34 years is a 16-year difference.
8. I ask whether older children are more likely than younger children to communicate with their parents.
9. I ask whether older children are less likely than younger children to communicate with their parents.
10. Many people who are my age live in my neighborhood.
11. Many people who are my age intend to attend college.
12. A person can choose a course in life.
13. Depending on the course in life, a person can belong to a group.
14. One group is a group of people who leave home far away.
15. The headline is: How do you get in touch with your parents?
